entry.title: Vera Brodsky Lawrence (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vera Brodsky Lawrence (pictured) hated being called the "queen of ragtime" despite being a catalyst for the revival of Scott Joplin's music?

entry.title: Skyline Madrid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Skyline Madrid was built on the most expensive plot of land ever sold in Madrid?

entry.title: Usha Sundaram (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that independent India's first female pilot, Usha Sundaram, holds the record for the fastest flight between England and India in a piston-engine aircraft?

entry.title: fictional life on Pluto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that fictional life on Pluto has included mist creatures and crystals?

entry.title: Sylvester da Cunha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1966 Sylvester da Cunha modelled the Amul girl to contrast with the mascot of Amul's main rival, Polson?

entry.title: Brooklyn Central Library (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the façade of the Brooklyn Central Library was removed in an attempt to save money?

entry.title: Alexandra Pinell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that footballer Alexandra Pinell scored the Costa Rica U20 team's only goal at the FIFA tournament hosted by their country?

entry.title: personal debt was regularly cancelled (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that personal debt was regularly cancelled in the ancient Near East?
